moves.2... d5 3. d4: Baiting him. This move is not found in GK's database.
moves.3... dxe4: In truth, this was a risky gambit. The passed pawn has the potential to cause much grief later on.
moves.4. Nd2: Better than Nc3, which can be pinned. I plan on pulling the pawn closer to the jaws of death.
moves.5... e3: I had planned on playing Ne4 here, but that is impossible now.
moves.6... Nd5: If I would have been thinking, I would have traded for the pawn.
moves.7. Bg2 Nxf4 8. Bf3 Qh4+: I thought I was in trouble, but after closer inspection, I found there wasn't too much to fear.
moves.9. Kf1 e2+: Fail. He throws his attack out of the window.
moves.11. Qxe2 Be7 12. h3: I immediately think of trapping the Queen.
moves.12... O-O 13. Nf3 Qf6 14. Bg5: The Queen is as good as dead, now, since there is only one open square. Maybe Qxf3+ then taking the Bishop would have been good.
moves.14... Qg6 15. Nce5 Qxg5 16. Nxg5 Bxg5: But the same outcome is reached.
moves.17. h4 Be7 18. g5 f6: Discovered checks are nasty, but this one is quite benign.
moves.26... Nh6: Now for a pretty lil sacrifice.
moves.27. Rg4xg7+ Bxg7 28. Qg2 Nf5 29. h6 Rf6: I'm trying, once more, to bait him. This time a royal fork is the bait.
moves.32. Nxf3: Taking with the Rook is not a good option.
moves.32... Rxf3 33. Qd8+ Kf7 34. g8=B#: And I promote to a Bishop to mate! Gotta love under promotions! I hope you enjoyed it! Please rate and comment!

gameName: Bishop Promo Mate and a Queen trap
